warning_message: Locking knees during exercises can cause hyperextension injuries and joint damage
safe_alternative: Keep a slight bend in your knees to protect the joint

warning_message: Bouncing during lifts can cause muscle tears, joint injuries, and loss of control
safe_alternative: Use controlled movements with a brief pause at the bottom of each rep

triggers: arch your back as much as possible
warning_message: Excessive back arching during exercises can cause spinal disc injuries
safe_alternative: Maintain a neutral spine with natural curvature throughout the movement

warning_message: Skipping warmup significantly increases risk of muscle strains and joint injuries
safe_alternative: Always warm up for 5-10 minutes before intense exercise

warning_message: Behind-the-neck movements put extreme stress on shoulder joints and rotator cuffs
safe_alternative: Perform presses to the front and pulldowns to the chest

warning_message: This is outdated advice - preventing forward knee travel forces hip and back compensation
safe_alternative: Allow natural knee tracking over toes for proper squat mechanics

warning_message: Sharp or joint pain during exercise indicates potential injury - not normal muscle fatigue
safe_alternative: Stop exercises that cause sharp pain and consult a professional

warning_message: Rounding the spine under load dramatically increases disc herniation risk
safe_alternative: Maintain a neutral spine with engaged core throughout the lift

warning_message: Static stretching cold muscles can reduce power output and may increase injury risk
safe_alternative: Do dynamic warmup before exercise, save static stretching for after
source: Journal of Strength and Conditioning Research

warning_message: Kipping without strict pullup strength causes shoulder injuries
safe_alternative: Master strict pullups before attempting kipping variations
